CCamera.cpp

00001 /*
00002  * CCamera.h
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: 09.03.2010
00005  *      Author: pizza2004 and gerstrong
00006  *
00007  *  This camera class is used for the scrolling during the "gameplay".
00008  *  The old values of that used that class are now a structure part of CVideoDriver
00009  *  This class will be another object that will following the player
00010  *  It has the feature to attach to any object in the game scenario and follow it.
00011  *  It also can detached and moved manually. That might be used for
00012  *  the active Level viewer feature.
00013  */
00014 
00015 
00016 #include "CCamera.h"
00017 #include "../CLogFile.h"
00018 #include "../sdl/CVideoDriver.h"
00019 #include "../sdl/CInput.h"
00020 #include "spritedefines.h"
00021 
00022 CCamera::CCamera(CMap *pmap, Uint32 x, Uint32 y):
00023 CObject(pmap, x, y, OBJ_NONE),
00024 mp_AttachedObject(NULL)
00025 {
00026  g_pLogFile->ftextOut("Starting the camera system...<br>");
00027  sprite = BLANKSPRITE;
00028  solid = false;
00029 }
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * This function will attach the camera to the object and scroll
00033  * automatically with it
00034  */
00035 void CCamera::attachToObject(CObject &attacher)
00036 { mp_AttachedObject = &attacher; }
00037 
00038 /**
00039  * This function will dettach the camera from a object.
00040  * If this happens, the camera can be scrolled manually.
00041  */
00042 bool CCamera::detach()
00043 {
00044  if(!mp_AttachedObject)
00045   return false;
00046  else
00047  {
00048   mp_AttachedObject = NULL;
00049   return true;
00050  }
00051 }
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * This is main cycle which will be called every Logic loop
00055  * Here it moves automatically, performs the smooth scrolling
00056  * and gets the controls to move when it's not attached to an object
00057  */
00058 void CCamera::process()
00059 {
00060  if(mp_AttachedObject == NULL)
00061  { // This means, that there is no attached object. Let the camera scroll freely!
00062   size_t movespeed = 100;
00063 
00064   if(g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_LEFT))
00065    moveLeft(movespeed);
00066   else if(g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_RIGHT))
00067    moveRight(movespeed);
00068   if(g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_UP))
00069    moveUp(movespeed);
00070   else if(g_pInput->getHoldedCommand(IC_DOWN))
00071    moveDown(movespeed);
00072  }
00073  else
00074  {
00075   if(mp_AttachedObject->getXPosition() > x)
00076    moveRight(mp_AttachedObject->getXPosition() - x );
00077   else if(mp_AttachedObject->getXPosition() < x)
00078    moveLeft(x - mp_AttachedObject->getXPosition());
00079 
00080   if(mp_AttachedObject->getYPosition() > y)
00081    moveDown(mp_AttachedObject->getYPosition() - y);
00082   else if(mp_AttachedObject->getYPosition() < y)
00083    moveUp(y - mp_AttachedObject->getYPosition());
00084 
00085  }
00086 
00087  int px, py, left, up, right, down, speed;
00088 
00089  Uint16& scroll_x = mp_Map->m_scrollx;
00090  Uint16& scroll_y = mp_Map->m_scrolly;
00091 
00092  px = (getXPosition()>>STC)-scroll_x;
00093  py = (getYPosition()>>STC)-scroll_y;
00094 
00095  st_camera_bounds CameraBounds = g_pVideoDriver->getCameraBounds();
00096  left = CameraBounds.left;
00097  up = CameraBounds.up;
00098  right = CameraBounds.right;
00099  down = CameraBounds.down;
00100  speed = CameraBounds.speed;
00101 
00102  // left-right scrolling
00103  if(px > right && scroll_x < mp_Map->m_maxscrollx)
00104  {
00105   do{
00106    px = (getXPosition()>>STC)-scroll_x;
00107    mp_Map->scrollRight();
00108   }while(px > right+speed && scroll_x < mp_Map->m_maxscrollx);
00109  }
00110  else if(px < left && scroll_x > 32)
00111  {
00112   do{
00113    px = (getXPosition()>>STC)-scroll_x;
00114    mp_Map->scrollLeft();
00115   }while(px < left-speed && scroll_x > 32);
00116  }
00117 
00118  // up-down scrolling
00119  if (py > down && scroll_y < mp_Map->m_maxscrolly)
00120  {
00121   do{
00122    py = (getYPosition()>>STC)-scroll_y;
00123    mp_Map->scrollDown();
00124   }while(py > down+speed && scroll_y < mp_Map->m_maxscrolly);
00125  }
00126  else if ( py < up && scroll_y > 32  )
00127  {
00128   do{
00129    py = (getYPosition()>>STC)-scroll_y;
00130    mp_Map->scrollUp();
00131   }while(py < up-speed && scroll_y > 32);
00132  }
00133 
00134  // This will always snap correctly to the edge
00135  while(scroll_x < 32)
00136   mp_Map->scrollRight();
00137  while(scroll_x > mp_Map->m_maxscrollx)
00138   mp_Map->scrollLeft();
00139  while(scroll_y < 32)
00140   mp_Map->scrollDown();
00141  while(scroll_y > mp_Map->m_maxscrolly)
00142   mp_Map->scrollUp();
00143 
00144 }
